item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, September 14, 2024 at 1:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Valkey achieved one million RPS 6 months after forking from Redis (34 points | 6 comments)
2. The Department of Everything – Dispatches from the telephone reference desk (11 points | 3 comments)
3. Show HN: Meet.hn – Meet the Hacker News community in your city (37 points | 5 comments)
4. They don't make readers like they used to (6 points | 1 comment)
5. My 71 TiB ZFS NAS After 10 Years and Zero Drive Failures (329 points | 232 comments)
6. Why use metaphors in conflicts? Because understanding is remembering in disguise (2009) (30 points | 17 comments)
7. The data on extreme human ageing is rotten from the inside out (37 points | 8 comments)
8. Icon (real creators, AI ads) is hiring founding engineers (NYC) ( | hide)
9. Techniques I use to create a great user experience for shell scripts (316 points | 145 comments)
10. Lisp implemented in Rust macros (238 points | 58 comments)
11. Void captures over a million Android TV boxes (105 points | 52 comments)
12. Porting SBCL to the Nintendo Switch (358 points | 63 comments)
13. The Legend of Holy Sword: An Immersive Experience for Concentration Enhancement (107 points | 52 comments)
14. Billiards is a good game (1975) (45 points | 20 comments)
15. Intents: The Endgame for Computing Interfaces? (6 points | 2 comments)
16. Defend against vampires with 10 gbps network encryption (213 points | 66 comments)
17. CrowdStrike ex-employees: 'Quality control was not part of our process' (456 points | 219 comments)
18. Haskell Postgres Stored Procedures (41 points | 9 comments)
19. The Cellular Secret to Resisting the Pressure of the Deep Sea (65 points | 8 comments)
20. Grounding AI in reality with a little help from Data Commons (71 points | 6 comments)
21. Hypermedia Controls: Feral to Formal (PDF: ACM HT'24) (42 points | 15 comments)
22. Solving the bowling problem with dynamic programming (7 points | discuss)
23. Zero-Click Calendar invite vulnerability chain in macOS (407 points | 147 comments)
24. Coupled Oscillators for Computing (29 points | 8 comments)
25. Gottfried Mind, the Raphael of Cats (28 points | discuss)
26. Intel Solidifies $3.5B Deal to Make Chips for Military (154 points | 111 comments)
27. Ambient Meaning and the Algorithms of Culture (18 points | 6 comments)
28. Janet Jackson had the power to crash laptop computers (2022) (171 points | 55 comments)
29. Martin Luther King Jr. In Berlin (80 points | 19 comments)
30. JG Ballard's Apocalyptic Art (106 points | 29 comments)
